task_summary: Perceive the bread loaf on the tabletop, approach, compute a top grasp, close the gripper, and lift the bread off the table.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator must pick up a small bread/loaf item from a cluttered tabletop. The scene includes bottles, cups, and cans. The robot first perceives the bread, verifies visibility, prepares the gripper, and approaches from above with tight alignment. It computes a grasp pose, executes a pinch-style grasp, confirms the object is secured, then lifts and slightly retreats to clear the clutter. No placement is required; success is achieved when the bread is stably held above the surface.
preconditions: Robot is homed with reachable workspace over the table
Bread present on table and visible by camera
stepwise_plan: Detect and confirm visibility of the bread
Open gripper and move above the bread with a safe vertical offset
Compute a top grasp and execute a pinch grasp
Close gripper and verify object is in gripper
Lift the bread and retreat slightly from the clutter
success_criteria: Bread lifted at least 0.10 m from the table
failure_and_recovery: If alignment fails, re-approach from above
If grasp slips, reopen and regrasp with adjusted pose
If collisions detected, retreat and replan approach
task_long_description.termination: End after the bread is securely held and the robot has retreated from the table area.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear alignment above the bread with end-effector centered over the target.
frame_3.predicts_next: Closing and lift expected; confirms grasp execution is imminent.

node_specs.description: Verify bread remains visible before approach.
Move to a pregrasp pose above the bread.
Refine approach and align tightly over the target.
Compute top grasp pose and store on blackboard.
Close gripper with low force suitable for soft bread.
Lift the grasped bread from the table.
Back off to a safe position after lift.

failure_modes: Bread not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Grasp pose inaccurate leading to slip
Over-squeezing deforming bread and failing grasp
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection from slightly adjusted view
Re-approach from higher offset and re-align
Recompute grasp pose and retry pinch
Lower closing force, then reattempt grasp
assumptions: The tan/orange loaf near table center-left is the 'bread' target.
Top pinch grasp is feasible given object geometry and clutter.
No placement is required; task ends after secure lift.

expected_success_criteria: Bread lifted â‰¥0.10 m and maintained in gripper for at least 1 s
No collisions with surrounding objects during approach and lift
